result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Keipe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William E Keipe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William E Keipe was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William E Keipe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to OWI - 1st offense (2014TR19) and count 1 of 2015CM37, and count 2 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Johnson concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to OWI - 1st.  Court finds the defendant guilty and sentences the defendant to $150 forfeiture plus costs totalling $761.50; Blood Draw Fee $42.50; D.L. revocation for 6 months and OWI assessment.  Court orders 2015TR20 be dismissed.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $250 fine plus costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 10:43 a.m.

10:29 A.M .  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - matter can be set for plea & sentencing.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on June 16, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:30 a.m.

11:16 a.m.  No appearance bvy the defendant.  Atty Erik Johnson present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Johnson.  Court will set for status hearing on May 11, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.


Court adjourned at 11:17 a.m.

1:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Erik Johnson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Johnson enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 6, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Atty Johnson enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to the TR citations.

Court adjourned at 1:50 p.m.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

Shae from Atty Erik Johnson's office called, Atty Johnson has just been retained and requests this matter be rescheduled.  Matter rescheduled to March 9, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.  NOR in the mail today.
43
